intro: Trichera arvensis var. purpurea, commonly known as the purple field trichera, is a variant of the field trichera species. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its distinctive purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and roadsides, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in composite inflorescences. This variant is notable for its ornamental value and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
